subject: RE: [junit] Assert for doubles - what goes in the delta parameter ?
msgSnippet: Floating point arithmetic can t handle equality properly. I.e it might be that 3/6!=1/2 Usually, one of them is 0.5, while the other one is 0.49999999999999
messageBody:
Floating point arithmetic can't handle equality properly. I.e it might be
that
3/6!=1/2

Usually, one of them is 0.5, while the other one is 0.49999999999999

That's what the delta is for - it allows for an error margin. 1e-6 is fine
for me, most of the time. But it really depends on your domain what kind of
precision you're demanding.

Bye,
Robert
